This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends but also struggles with social connection.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely weigh the pros and cons of each pub and consider which friends might be there.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely weigh the pros and cons of each pub and consider which friends might be there.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be observing his friends and feeling a mix of contentment and longing.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who struggles with social connection and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, but also struggles with social connection.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be observing his friends and feeling a mix of contentment and longing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, but also struggles with social connection.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely observe his friends and feel a mix of contentment and longing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends but also struggles with social connection.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely weigh the pros and cons of each pub and consider which friends might be there.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
    scoring function

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and is hoping to gather friends at The Golden Fleece for the upcoming game.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece and hope his friends join him there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, or he could try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones likes to watch games at pubs with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker and is planning to watch the upcoming game at The Golden Fleece.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones likes to watch games at pubs with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker and is planning to watch the upcoming game at The Golden Fleece.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and is hoping to gather friends at The Golden Fleece for the upcoming game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, or he could try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece and hope his friends join him there.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a loyal and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value

It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.6666666666666666
      Alice Lewis: 0.6666666666666666
      Alexander White: 0.5
      Jack Taylor: 0.6666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 0.75
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Alice Lewis': "The King's Head", 'Alexander White': "The King's Head", 'Jack Taylor': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Golden Fleece'}

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head has better beer.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, but also struggles with social connection.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be observing his friends and feeling a mix of contentment and longing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends but struggles with social connection.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends but also struggles with social connection.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely weigh the pros and cons of each pub and consider which friends might be there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys spending time with his friends but struggles with social connection.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head has better beer.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head has better beer.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking disco ball of joy, their enthusiasm a glitter bomb that explodes in every conversation, making even traffic jams feel like a party.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with his friends in familiar and comfortable settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a market outing with his friends, discussing plans to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a market outing with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the lively atmosphere of the market, and perhaps savor a delicious pastry or coffee.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is enjoying himself at a market with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a market outing with his friends, discussing plans to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a market outing with friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head has better beer.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The King's Head, her preferred pub, to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends, chatting, and perhaps looking forward to the upcoming game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The King's Head, her preferred pub, to watch the game.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying coffee with friends and deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The King's Head, her preferred pub, to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The King's Head, her preferred pub, to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and escaping into books.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying coffee with friends and deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The King's Head, her preferred pub, to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Guys, how about The Golden Fleece? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Guys, how about The Golden Fleece? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is alright, but I was hoping we could go to The King's Head.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is a great choice. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game! It's where we always go!
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head has better beer.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The King's Head tonight? They have the best beer on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "This is lovely, isn't it? It's so nice to finally have some sunshine.
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head is alright, but I was hoping we could all go to The Golden Fleece tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Guys, how about The Golden Fleece? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has a preference for The Golden Fleece pub.

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends at pubs, especially The Golden Fleece, to watch football games.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time with friends at pubs, especially The Golden Fleece, to watch football games.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob to sneak into The Golden Fleece after hours. They spent the night playing a chaotic game of Risk, fueled by stolen soda and the thrill of breaking the rules. The adrenaline rush and the feeling of camaraderie solidified their bond, but also left a trail of overturned furniture and a very angry pub owner.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Guys, how about The Golden Fleece? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. They do a mean pint of ale there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, guys, it's gotta be The Golden Fleece! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The King's Head? They have a great atmosphere and the food is always good.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has a preference for The Golden Fleece pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we all head to The Golden Fleece tonight? They've got the best atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Guys, how about The Golden Fleece? It's got the best atmosphere for the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head

          Answer: Alexander White would likely weigh the pros and cons of each pub and consider which friends might be there.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)
